alert.note: Alert for Perry (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 19 at 4:58PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Perry, west central Meade and north central Breckinridge Counties through 530 PM EDT/430 PM CDT/... At 458 PM EDT/358 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northeast of Tell City, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Perry, west central Meade and north central Breckinridge Counties, including the following locations... Roberta, Concordia, Oriole, Derby, Lilly Dale, Magnet, Mount Pleasant, Terry, Gerald and Leopold. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT/700 PM CDT/ for south central Indiana...and central Kentucky.
